physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild upper cervical spine tenderness, soft grade-I systolic heart murmur, mild mitral and tricuspid valve prolapse with slight tricuspid and trivial mitral regurgitation, mildly dilated aortic root (27.8 mm), slight dolichostenomelia.
Postoperative radiographs showed reduction at C2-C3.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative alignment improved, with no subluxation at C3-C4.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Radiographs showed anterior subluxation of C3 on C4 with increased kyphotic angulation at this level.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Development of anterior subluxation of C3 on C4.

physical_examinations.date: Three months after the initial C2-C3 arthrodesis
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: C3-C4 posterior cervical arthrodesis performed; patient placed in a halo vest.
Underwent a third anterior arthrodesis at C4-C5 with structural allograft.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No evidence of additional subluxation; patient had no neck pain and no limitations of daily activities at four-year follow-up.
